interface.name: AccelSurface
interface.javadoc: Abstraction for a hardware accelerated surface.
Render-To Plain surface (pbuffer for OpenGL, Render Target surface for Direct3D)
A back-buffer surface (SwapChain surface for Direct3D, backbuffer for OpenGL)
Render-To Texture surface (fbobject for OpenGL, texture with render-to attribute for Direct3D)

Returns {@code int} representing surface's type as defined by constants in this interface.
an integer representing this surface's type
AccelSurface#UNDEFINED
AccelSurface#WINDOW
AccelSurface#RT_PLAIN
AccelSurface#TEXTURE
AccelSurface#FLIP_BACKBUFFER
AccelSurface#RT_TEXTURE

Returns a pointer to the native surface data associated with this surface. Note: this pointer is only valid on the rendering thread.
pointer to the native surface's data

Returns a pointer to the real native resource of the specified type associated with this AccelSurface. Note: this pointer is only valid on the rendering thread.
resType the type of the requested resource
a long containing a pointer to the native resource of the specified type or 0L if such resource doesn't exist for this surface

Returns whether the pipeline considers this surface valid. A surface may become invalid if it is disposed of, or resized.
true if valid, false otherwise

Returns whether this surface is lost. The return value is only valid on the render thread, meaning that even if this method returns{@code true} it could be lost in the next moment unless it is called on the rendering thread.
true if the surface is known to be lost, false otherwise

Returns the requested bounds of the destination surface. The real bounds of the native accelerated surface may differ. Use{@link #getNativeBounds} to get the bounds of the native surface.
Rectangle representing java surface's bounds

Returns real bounds of the native surface, which may differ from those returned by {@link #getBounds}.
Rectangle representing native surface's bounds
